properties.NAME: DogPatch USA
properties.DESCRIPTION: The now abandoned theme park opened in 1968 and was based on Al Capp's comic strip Lil Abner set in the fictional village of DogPatch.

properties.NAME: Hold $1 million in your hands
properties.DESCRIPTION: A fun part of the Arkansas State Capitol building tour, visitors are able to go into the treasurer's vault to hold and take pictures with the state's tax money.

properties.NAME: Wild Wilderness Drive-Thru
properties.DESCRIPTION: Basically.. a drive-thru zoo! 400 acres filled with exotic animals and featuring a petting zoo and picinic area.

properties.NAME: Snake World
properties.DESCRIPTION: A reptile ranch ran by Dale Ertel who provides an educational tour of over 70 species of reptiles(far more than the number of those dispayed at the Litlle Rock Zoo).

properties.NAME: Quigley's Castle
properties.DESCRIPTION: The dream home of Elise Quigley (1910-1984) who's grandchildren now keep up the unique property and invite visitors to wander through her perennial garden of over 400 varieties of flowers. You can also view her outstanding butterfly, arrrowhead, and fossil collections.

properties.NAME: Ozark Medieval Fortress
properties.DESCRIPTION: Abandoned and currenlty requiring a buyer or investor to be functonal, the Ozark Medieval Fortress is a project that was designed to construct an accurate replica of a 13th century French castle using only materials and techniques appropriate for that era.

properties.NAME: The Old Mill
properties.DESCRIPTION: Appearing in the opening scene of the renowned classic 'Gone with the Wind'(1939), this beautiful work of art is authentic replicaof an old water powered grist mill.

properties.NAME: Terra Studios
properties.DESCRIPTION: Being the home of the Original Bluebird of Happiness, with glassblowing demonstrations, a vast gallery,and an Art Park filled with sculptures, murals, art installations, and fountains, this is the ideal stop for art enthusiasts of all time.

properties.NAME: NASCAR Mark Martin Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: A state of the art museum woth an ellaborate display of several past cars and pieces of NASCAR history with hi-tech mantrons that tell the story of each piece.

properties.NAME: Giant Beer Can
properties.DESCRIPTION: Farmer and Budweiser lover Earle Harris Sr. painted one of his silos to look like a giant can of the brew circa 1975-76. Located southwest of town on the southeast corner of hwy 22 and 96.

properties.NAME: Ozark's Largest Rocking Chair
properties.DESCRIPTION: Standing 8ft tall and 5ft wide a picturein this enormous rocker is a must

properties.NAME: Maxwell Blade's Odditorium and Curiosities
properties.DESCRIPTION: A museum of over 300 oddities and rare exhibits.

properties.NAME: Billy Bass Adoption Center
properties.DESCRIPTION: Filled with hundreds of these annoying novelties, this is a place where poor Billy Bass come to die(sit tacked to a wall inevitably). Most brung in by wives who tell workers 'If he comes for it, tell him it isn't here.'

properties.NAME: Gaudy Goddess of Feminine Cosmic Energy
properties.DESCRIPTION: Aza, which is short for Adora Zerlina Astra was built in late 2012 by sculptor Bruce Anderson. She is a non-denominational goddess, a composite of various deities that Anderson says celebrates the feminine energy of the cosmos.

properties.NAME: Christ of the Ozarks
properties.DESCRIPTION: Christ of the Ozarks statue is a monumental sculpture of Jesus located near Eureka Springs, Arkansas, atop Magnetic Mountain. It was erected in 1966 as a 'Sacred Project' by Gerald L. K. Smith and stands 65.5 feet high.

properties.NAME: 4-Dice restaurant
properties.DESCRIPTION: Where the Rolling Stones ate before their arrest, July 5, 1975.
